item.title: Marbles add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "What is hell? I maintain that it is the suffering of being unable to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul" -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor hugo
item.description: "Music expresses that which cannot be put into words and that which cannot remain silent" -- Victor hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones; and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace. God is awake." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "And above all, watch with glittering eyes the whole world around you because the greatest secrets are always hidden in the most unlikely places. Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "So, please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookcase on the wall." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Thomas Harris
item.description: "I'm doing one of three things: I'm writing. I'm staring out the window. Or I'm writhing on the floor." -- Thomas Harris

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "Listen to the mustn'ts, child. Listen to the don'ts. Listen to the shouldn'ts, the impossibles, the won'ts. Listen to the never haves, then listen close to me... Anything can happen, child. Anything can be." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Shel Silverstein
item.description: "How many slams in an old screen door? Depends how loud you shut it. How many slices in a bread? Depends how thin you cut it. How much good inside a day? Depends how good you live 'em. How much love inside a friend? Depends how much you give 'em." -- Shel Silverstein

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "There is neither happiness nor misery in the world; there is only the comparison of one state with another, nothing more. He who has felt the deepest grief is best able to experience supreme happiness. We must have felt what it is to die, Morrel, that we may appreciate the enjoyments of life. " Live, then, and be happy, beloved children of my heart, and never forget, that until the day God will deign to reveal the future to man, all human wisdom is contained in these two words, 'Wait and Hope." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Bram Stoker
item.description: "We learn from failure, not from success!" -- Bram Stoker

item.title: Marbles add a quote by George Harrison
item.description: "If you don't know where you're going, any road'll take you there" -- George Harrison

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Above all, don't lie to yourself. The man who lies to himself and listens to his own lie comes to a point that he cannot distinguish the truth within him, or around him, and so loses all respect for himself and for others. And having no respect he ceases to love." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Right or wrong, it's very pleasant to break something from time to time." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "The awful thing is that beauty is mysterious as well as terrible. God and the devil are fighting there and the battlefield is the heart of man." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "God knows what is in me in place of me." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved -- loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "So long as there shall exist, by reason of law and custom, a social condemnation which, in the midst of civilization, artificially creates a hell on earth, and complicates with human fatality a destiny that is divine; so long as the three problems of the century - the degradation of man by the exploitation of his labour, the ruin of women by starvation and the atrophy of childhood by physical and spiritual night are not solved; so long as, in certain regions, social asphyxia shall be possible; in other words and from a still broader point of view, so long as ignorance and misery remain on earth, there should be a need for books such as this." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "The future has several names. For the weak, it is impossible; for the fainthearted, it is unknown; but for the valiant, it is ideal." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "To love or have loved, that is enough. Ask nothing further. There is no other pearl to be found in the dark folds of life." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Marbles add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Think you're escaping and run into yourself. Longest way round is the shortest way home." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Secrets, silent, stony sit in the dark palaces of both our hearts: secrets weary of their tyranny: tyrants willing to be dethroned." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Shut your eyes and see." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "A corpse is meat gone bad. Well and what's cheese? Corpse of milk. " -- James Joyce

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Every life is in many days, day after day. We walk through ourselves, meeting robbers, ghosts, giants, old men, young men, wives, widows, brothers-in-love. But always meeting ourselves." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description:
"He read the verses backwards but then they were not poetry. Then he read the flyleaf from the bottom to the top till he came to his own name. That was he: and he read down the page again. What was after the universe?
Nothing. But was there anything round the universe to show where it stopped before the nothing place began?
It could not be a wall; but there could be a thin thin line there all round everything. It was very big to think about everything and everywhere. Only God could do that. He tried to think what a big thought that must be; but he could only think of God. God was God's name just as his name was Stephen." -- James Joyce

item.title: Marbles add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "He was alone. He was unheeded, happy, and near to the wild heart of life. He was alone and young and wilful and wildhearted, alone amid a waste of wild air and brackish waters and the seaharvest of shells and tangle and veiled grey sunlight." -- James Joyce
